etymologies: 1920s: from French calligramme, from calli- (in calligraphie ‘calligraphy’) + -gramme (in idéogramme ‘ideogram’)

definitions: a word or piece of text in which the design and layout of the letters creates a visual image related to the meaning of the words themselves

examples.text: an anonymous artist has transformed Dione's image into a calligram

shortDefinitions: word or piece of text in which design and layout of letters creates visual image related to meaning of words themselves
